meanings.definition: Capable of being entertained or amused.
meanings.sent1: The funny movie was very amusable for the kids.
meanings.sent2: The playful puppy was an amusable sight for the family.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics were quite amusable to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her witty jokes made the whole room amusable with laughter.
meanings.sent5: The colorful circus was an amusable experience for everyone.

meanings.definition: Able to be enjoyed or found entertaining.
meanings.sent1: The delicious cake was amusable to all the party guests.
meanings.sent2: The exciting game was an amusable way to spend the afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The amusing story was quite amusable for the children.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful artwork made the gallery an amusable place to visit.
meanings.sent5: The lively music concert was an amusable event for music lovers.
